title: Problems in Ubuntu Xenial Packages for Gazebo 8.1

content.raw:
Hi everyone (in particular @\_jrivero\_ that is probably interested in this), 
 this morning we noticed a strange behaviour when tryng to update a Gazebo 8 package in Xenial. 

In particular we got this error: 
~~~
isaac@iiticubws014:/usr/local/src/robot/idyntree/build (add-sole-gui)$ sudo apt install gazebo8
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 gazebo8 : Depends: libgazebo8 (= 8.0.0-1~xenial) but it is not going to be installed
           Depends: libsdformat5 but it is not going to be installed
           Depends: gazebo8-common (= 8.0.0-1~xenial) but 8.1.0-1~xenial is to be installed
           Recommends: gazebo8-plugin-base
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
~~~ 

This seems indeed coherent with what you can currently see in http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable/dists/xenial/main/binary-amd64/Packages (cached version: https://gist.github.com/traversaro/7b8749197763bd5a6df2d35450aa53b9 ) , in which there is the `gazebo8` debian package, version 8.0.0 that depends on `gazebo8-common` 8.0.0, but only `gazebo8-common` 8.1.0 is available in the repo.
content.html:
Hi everyone (in particular @_jrivero_ that is probably interested in this), this morning we noticed a strange behaviour when tryng to update a Gazebo 8 package in Xenial.

In particular we got this error: 

isaac@iiticubws014:/usr/local/src/robot/idyntree/build (add-sole-gui)$ sudo apt install gazebo8
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 gazebo8 : Depends: libgazebo8 (= 8.0.0-1~xenial) but it is not going to be installed
           Depends: libsdformat5 but it is not going to be installed
           Depends: gazebo8-common (= 8.0.0-1~xenial) but 8.1.0-1~xenial is to be installed
           Recommends: gazebo8-plugin-base
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

This seems indeed coherent with what you can currently see in http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable/dists/xenial/main/binary-amd64/Packages (cached version: https://gist.github.com/traversaro/7b8749197763bd5a6df2d35450aa53b9 ) , in which there is the gazebo8 debian package, version 8.0.0 that depends on gazebo8-common 8.0.0, but only gazebo8-common 8.1.0 is available in the repo.
